Ihis request for amendment is necessitated by roughly seven months of
negotiations on earlier contract changes etnd amendments that were requested
by the Advisory Committee, and in principle, felt by the Office of Education
to be worthwhile suggestions* The delays were not the fault of any one of
the parties to the contract, but a result of the lengthy discussion and
negotiation which is required to assure that changes are necessary and that
they are being presented and executed in an effective manner. The delays have,
however, made it necessary to adjust the schedule of the project and it is for
this reason that this request is being submitted*
The Office of Education has already approved, in principle, an extension of
this project to cover at least the period of time during which the films will
be produced. By agreement with the Office of Education, the University of
Texas, and the National Association of Educational Broadcasters, the last film
to be produced should be finished on April 1, 1965* Ibis alone would require
an amendment to cover the time between August 3I, 1964, aiid April 1, 1965* An
extension to October 31> 1965, however, is requested to allow for an evaluation
of the materials, which was listed as part of the original contract.
!Ihis evaluation was contemplated as a period of time during which the materials
could be used, users could provide reactions and comments about the material,
and a detailed evaluation report could be made by the Advisory Committee on
the usefulness and effectiveness of the kits. Because the summer months
provide a particularly fertile period for the use of such materials in workshops
and short courses in educaxjional television, it is requested that the project
be extended through the summer period to allow for concentaiated use and
evaluation of the kits and for a short time beyond that to allow for preparation
of a report*

SUMMARY
The NAEB is requesting an extension of its contract #0E 3*16-007 and an
amendment of the budget to carry out the requirements of the contract. Because
of various delays in the development to date, the extension is required to
cover the period during which films will be produced, and the distribution
and evaluation of the films can be made#
The request calls for an extension of the contract from August 31, 1964, to
October 31, 1965, and requires a total budget amendment involving a total
of $23,851.00.
